# Code Review Checklist

## General Code Quality
- [ ] Readable and well-organized code
- [ ] Meaningful variable and function names
- [ ] No unnecessary code or commented-out blocks
- [ ] No obvious bugs or logic errors

## TypeScript
- [ ] Appropriate and consistent use of types
- [ ] Minimal use of `any` type
- [ ] Well-defined interfaces and types
- [ ] Type assertions used only when necessary

## React
- [ ] Small, focused, reusable components
- [ ] Correct use of hooks
- [ ] State managed at appropriate level
- [ ] Props validated and documented
- [ ] Proper handling of side effects

## Redux
- [ ] Well-structured actions, reducers, selectors
- [ ] Normalized and minimal state
- [ ] Clean handling of async logic
- [ ] Avoidance of unnecessary re-renders

## Material-UI
- [ ] Correct use of MUI components
- [ ] Consistent theming
- [ ] Use of MUI styling solutions
- [ ] Accessibility features considered

## Testing
- [ ] Unit and integration tests present
- [ ] Edge cases covered
- [ ] Tests follow conventions

## Documentation
- [ ] Necessary comments
- [ ] Documentation for complex code
- [ ] Updated README/docs

## Performance & Security
- [ ] No performance bottlenecks
- [ ] Secure handling of sensitive data
- [ ] Safe, up-to-date dependencies

## Accessibility
- [ ] Accessible UI components
- [ ] Use of semantic HTML
